div.title: description
div.p: This action represents the matching of a trigger code to one of the values in the eRSD value sets.

td.div: Match of a code to one of the values in the eRSD value sets.

div.title: description
div.p: This action represents the initial creation of the eICR.

td.div: eICR construction delay (offsetDuration.value = x hours) - time after trigger event before an eICR should be created.

div.title: description
div.p: This action represents the periodic update of the eICR.

td.div: eICR periodic update (repeat.frequency = y hours) - the time after an initial eICR creation to send a new eICR as an update during long encounters.

div.title: description
div.p: This action represents the close out of an eICR encounter.

td.div: eICR encounter close out (timingTiming.repeat.duration = z hours) - the time after the end of the encounter to create the final eICR when there have been one or more trigger events.

div.title: description
div.p: This action represents the validation of an eICR.

div.title: description
div.p: This action represents the routing and sending of an eICR.

description.value: This action represents the matching of a trigger code to one of the values in the eRSD value sets.

description.value: This action represents the initial creation of the eICR.

description.value: This action represents the periodic update of the eICR.

textEquivalent.value: eICR periodic update (repeat.frequency = y hours) - the time after an initial eICR creation to send a new eICR as an update during long encounters.

description.value: This action represents the close out of an eICR encounter.

textEquivalent.value: eICR encounter close out (timingTiming.repeat.duration = z hours) - the time after the end of the encounter to create the final eICR when there have been one or more trigger events.

description.value: This action represents the validation of an eICR.
This action represents the routing and sending of an eICR.

td.div: This release includes code updates for the existing conditions and adds codes for Parkinsons disease and 13 enteric conditions. Medication codes have also been added to this version.

description.value: This release includes code updates for the existing conditions and adds codes for Parkinsons disease and 13 enteric conditions. Medication codes have also been added to this version.

purpose.value: Triggers for initiating decision support for electronic case reports

td.div: Example Diagnosis Problem Triggers for Public Health Reporting
HL7 Public Health and Emergency Response WorkGroup

div.title: description
div.p: This example set of values contains diagnoses or problems that represent that the patient may have a potentially reportable condition regardless of the clinical presentation of the condition

td.div: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright@copy; 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement. The ICD-10 is copyrighted by the WHO, which owns and publishes the classification. For US Clinical Modification (ICD-9-CM / ICD-10-CM)Contact: National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS), Center for Disease Control and Prevention http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/icd/icd10cm.htm#10update http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/icd/icd9.htm http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/icd.htm.
Chlamydia trachomatis infection in mother complicating childbirth (disorder)
Cardiac disorder due to typhoid fever (disorder)

HL7 Public Health and Emergency Response WorkGroup

Bordetella pertussis Ab [Titer] in Unspecified specimen

td.div: Example Medications Triggers for Public Health Reporting

div.title: description
div.p: This example set of values contains CVX, RXNORM,and SNOMED medication codes that may represent that the patient may have a potentially reportable condition. These pertain to medications administered and medications prescribed, where the medication, coded in CVX,RXNORM,SNOMED, may be indicative of a reportable condition.

td.div: Prescription drugs names used in observations documented in a clinical record.
Carbidopa 10 MG / Levodopa 100 MG Disintegrating Oral Tablet [Parcopa]
Carbidopa 25 MG / Levodopa 250 MG Disintegrating Oral Tablet
Carbidopa 25 MG / Levodopa 100 MG Extended Release Oral Tablet
Carbidopa 10 MG / Levodopa 100 MG Oral Tablet [Sinemet]
8 HR Carbidopa 48.75 MG / Levodopa 195 MG Extended Release Oral Capsule
Carbidopa 25 MG / Levodopa 100 MG Disintegrating Oral Tablet

td.div: Example Immunizations Triggers for Public Health Reporting

div.title: description
div.p: This example set of values contains CVX vaccine codes that may represent that the patient may have a potentially reportable condition. These pertain to vaccines administered and prescribed, where the vaccine, coded in CVX, may be indicative of a reportable condition.

td.div: Vaccine drug names used in observations documented in a clinical record.
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and pertussis vaccine
measles, mumps and rubella virus vaccine

title.value: Example Immunizations Triggers for Public Health Reporting
